text: Obama announces new sanctions on Russia
the latest US sanctions are intended to
ratchet up the pressure on Russia as a
continued to destabilize eastern Ukraine
White House correspondent Peter Baker on
the push to contain Putin today on the
New York Times minute we are going to be
moving forward with an expanded list of
individuals and companies 17 Russian
businesses are targeted in this latest
round these are people who are
considered to be Putin cronies that's
the phrase the US uses and now their
businesses will be affected just like
the individuals the move underscores the
urgency felt by the White House
considering Putin's activities in recent
days but remember these measures have
been in the works for weeks Treasury
Department can't simply put a firm or an
individual on its list banning assets
without a firm legal foundation that it
believes it can defend in court there's
also the matter of coordination with the
28 members of the European Union the
goal here is not to go after mr. Putin
personally scholars have long suspected
that mr. Putin has a secret fortune
potentially vulnerable to sanctions that
may be a future target but for now the
administration is aiming at those close
to Putin as one United States Senator
put it it's like a series of bombs going
off all around you eventually you see
that they're getting closer
